title: Mexican Tomato Growers Brace for U.S. Import Tariffs
summary: Florida growers had pushed Washington to terminate agreement that had set minimum prices for imported Mexican tomatoes. summary: Seven pieces that work for a high-desert sojourn or a low-key beach trip. A striped short-sleeved button down that's anything but typical. Price upon request, similar styles at bodenewyork.com

title: The Companies That Really Suffer From the 737 MAX Debacle
summary: Cash-strapped airlines like Norwegian Air have the most to lose from grounding jets. Stock investors have punished Boeing after two deadly crashes involving its 737 MAX jet. But some of its clients in the airline industry look more vulnerable to the fallout.

title: ZTE's State Owner to Cut Its Stake
summary: Shares in the Chinese telecom giant, which is still recovering from a bruising last year by U.S. authorities, fell 7.8% Wednesday. HONG KONG-The state-backed owner of China's ZTE Corp. is cutting its stake in the telecoms giant, which is recovering from a bruising run-in with U.S. authorities last year.

title: Spotify Accuses Apple of Stifling Competition in EU Complaint
summary: Complaint alleges that Apple has abused its control over which apps appear in its App Store. Music-streaming service Spotify Technology SA has filed an antitrust complaint in Europe against Apple Inc., a new salvo in the broader battle over whether and how to rein in global tech giants.

title: Condé Nast, Seeking Extra Revenue, Turns to Professionals
summary: Resume Subscription. Architectural Digest, the Condé Nast magazine best known for its design savvy and access to celebrity homes, is launching a business-to-business digital offering for architects, decorators and contractors as the publisher moves to cater to professionals.

title: Accelerators Try Their Hand at Online Schools to Reach More Would-Be Founders
summary: Prospective founders can test their mettle thanks to the arrival of online courses designed to bring the accelerator experience to anyone with a laptop. Is entrepreneurship for everyone?

title: Elon Musk Set to Unveil a New Tesla for the Masses
summary: The all-electric compact sport-utility vehicle is critical to auto maker's bid to move from posh to popular. Elon Musk is back to pitching another all-electric vehicle that the Tesla Inc. chief needs to be a hit to turn the upstart auto maker into a mass-market car company.

title: Most of Boeing 737 MAX Fleet Grounded Amid Safety Concerns
summary: Authorities in Asia, Middle East join regulators from China to Europe in grounding the 737 MAX after a second crash in five months. Flights of Boeing Co.'s troubled 737 MAX were suspended in several more countries, putting most of the global fleet out of action and raising further pressure on the U.S. plane maker.

title: Pandora Pitches Ads Targeted to Amazon and Google Smart Speakers
summary: Brands try to crack voice marketing in the restrictive worlds of Alexa and Google Assistant. Pandora Media has begun selling commercial time in streams playing just on Amazon Echo and Google Home smart speakers, opening a path for advertisers to target people as they use voice-activated assistants.

title: China's Insurance Giant Thinks It's a Tech Company. Maybe It Is.
summary: Ping An's latest results show its heavy investment in technology is driving strong profit growth. Stock markets are brimming with financial companies eager to be valued like high-growth tech stocks. Ping An, the world's second-largest insurer by market value, has a more compelling case than most.

title: How Much for 5G? Verizon Says $10 Extra Per Month
summary: Carrier's unlimited-data customers will have to pay more for fastest service, set to launch in Chicago and Minneapolis in April. Verizon Communications Inc. will charge an additional $10 a month per smartphone for subscribers who want to add 5G speeds to their devices, the first major U.S. carrier to disclose pricing for the faster cellular service.

title: How GE Built Up and Wrote Down $22 Billion in Assets
summary: GE's goodwill move enabled conglomerate to avoid costs that would have reduced its earnings. When General Electric Co. bought Alstom SA's power business in 2015, it cost it a little more than $10 billion.

title: Chinese Houses Aren't for Frying-Well, Maybe a Light Sauté
summary: The omission of a familiar dictum in a government report prompts questions about Beijing's housing policy. Chinese Kremlinology has always been a difficult art. Market watchers betting on policy changes are often reduced to taking cues from what top leaders don't say, as much as from what they do.

title: EU Moves to Confront China's Growing Assertiveness
summary: European Commission steers closer to U.S. view as it labels China an economic rival and prepares to combat Beijing's threats to trade, economic growth and security. The European Union moved Tuesday to recalibrate ties with China, promising to address growing threats to trade, economic growth and security posed by Beijing's global assertiveness.

title: More Catholics Considering Abandoning the Church
summary: Thirty-seven percent said they were questioning this year whether to remain part of the church, up from 22% in 2002. More than a third of U.S. Catholics say the sexual abuse crisis rocking the Catholic Church has made them consider leaving the church, significantly more than when the last major scandal erupted, according to new research conducted by Gallup.

title: Hong Kong Spends Nearly $700 Million to Bolster Currency
summary: A glut of cash in Hong Kong's financial system has pushed down market interest rates, depressing the city's currency. A glut of cash in Hong Kong's financial system has pushed down market interest rates, depressing the city's currency and forcing authorities to spend $692 million of foreign reserves defending its long-running link to the U.S. dollar.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Starbucks Fights Hot Startup in China
summary: Coffee giant's battle with Luckin highlights value of delivery services in world's second-biggest economy, even at the expense of profits. Starbucks Corp. built its empire in China on the idea that consumers there would want to be seen inside its posh cafes.

title: Israel: Hezbollah Operative Is Setting Up Golan Heights Terror Network
summary: The U.S. charged Ali Mussa Daqduq with orchestrating the 2007 kidnapping and murder of five American soldiers in Iraq; Netanyahu government pushes for sovereignty over strategic area. GOLAN HEIGHTS-Israel said a Hezbollah operative accused of killing U.S. troops is establishing a terror network in the disputed Golan Heights, spotlighting threats the militant group poses to its security as the Netanyahu government pushes for sovereignty over the strategic area.

title: Actress Felicity Huffman, Designer Mossimo Giannulli Appear in Court Amid Cheating Scandal
summary: Huffman, Giannulli post bail in California appearance; neither enters a plea. LOS ANGELES-Actress Felicity Huffman and clothing designer Mossimo Giannulli made their first appearances in federal court in Los Angeles Tuesday following their arrests in a broad criminal case over alleged cheating to get their children into elite colleges.

title: California Governor to Order Halt of Executions
summary: State has about one quarter of the nation's death row inmates. SAN FRANCISCO-California Gov. Gavin Newsom is expected to sign an executive order on Wednesday placing a moratorium on executions, marking a significant step in a nationwide slowdown in the use of the death penalty.

title: A Who's Who Among the Parents in the College Admissions Scandal
summary: In addition to Hollywood celebrities, the former CEO of Pimco and the founder of TPG Growth are among those named by prosecutors. Federal prosecutors charged 33 parents in a wide-ranging college admissions scheme, alleging that they paid for bogus entrance-exam scores and fake athletic achievements to get their children admitted to competitive colleges.

title: U.S., Ethiopia Maneuver Over Crashed Plane's Black Boxes
summary: Washington wants NTSB to download data from recorders, while African nation's officials prefer U.K. experts. U.S. air-safety investigators on Tuesday engaged in intense behind-the-scenes discussions with their Ethiopian counterparts regarding where the black-box recorders found amid the wreckage of Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 will be downloaded, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Desperate Looters Ravage Power-Starved Western Venezuela
summary: People ransack food shops and scramble to find water and fuel, as blackout extends into sixth day; prominent journalist is arrested, accused of being part of a plot to foster outages. CARACAS, Venezuela-Looters ransacked businesses in western Venezuela as people across the country struggled to fill gas tanks and obtain food and water, which can't be adequately pumped to customers because of an epic blackout that began on Thursday.

title: Two Former Police Officers Charged in Killing of Brazilian Activist Marielle Franco
summary: Prosecutors allege the men planned last year's assassination for three months. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian police investigating the assassination last year of Rio de Janeiro councilwoman Marielle Franco on Tuesday arrested two former military policemen whom prosecutors accuse of carrying out her murder.

title: Cardinal George Pell Sent to Prison for Sexually Assaulting Choirboys
summary: Sentence took into account severity of the crimes, but was mitigated by the cardinal's age, health and otherwise good character, judge said. MELBOURNE, Australia-Cardinal George Pell, the Vatican's former finance chief, was sentenced to six years in prison Wednesday for sexually abusing two choirboys inside a Melbourne cathedral in the 1990s.

title: Federal Prosecutors Charge Dozens in College Admissions Cheating Scheme
summary: Charges involve cheating on college entrance exams, efforts to bribe coaches; actresses Felicity Huffman, Lori Loughlin among those indicted. BOSTON-Federal prosecutors charged dozens of wealthy parents-including prominent law and business figures and two Hollywood actresses-with using bribes, bogus entrance-exam scores and faked athletic achievements to get their children admitted to elite colleges.

title: ANGI Homeservices Promotes Insider to CFO
summary: Jamie Cohen was most recently executive vice president of finance and accounting. Angie's List parent ANGI Homeservices Inc. on Tuesday promoted Jamie Cohen to chief financial officer.

title: Boeing Crash Fallout Spreads as More 737 MAX Jets Are Idled
summary: Bulk of aircraft's global fleet is now parked; European regulators ground plane, breaking with U.S. counterparts. Boeing Co. 's woes escalated as European aviation regulators joined Asian and Latin American authorities in grounding the 737 MAX jet, and lawmakers on Capitol Hill urged U.S. airlines to voluntarily park those planes after two deadly crashes of the aircraft in the past five months.

title: Reining in Big Tech: A Middle Way
summary: Government-appointed panel seeks to bolster competition without invasive regulation. Facebook Inc., Amazon.com Inc. and Google reached the pinnacle of business through relentless innovation, yet from that pinnacle they now stand accused by many of strangling competition and consumer choice. Can the latter be curbed without sacrificing the former?
